definition[0]: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
example[1]: a triple bill of horror movies
definition[1]: three times more than a particular number
example[4]: The rail system has triple the average number of accidents.
definition[2]: to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this
example[5]: The company has tripled in size.
example[6]: We expect to triple our profits next year.
definition[3]: a hit of the ball in baseball that allows the batter to get to the third base
definition[4]: three turns of your body in a sport such as ice skating or gymnastics
example[7]: Music sales saw triple-digit growth in the last financial year.
example[8]: a triple alliance of the government, state industries and foreign firms
definition[6]: to become three times as much or as many, or to make something do this
example[10]: The newspaper tripled its circulation in less than a year.
